verses.text: If a prophet or a dreamer of dreams rises among you and gives you a sign or a wonder,
verses.comment: Translates 'gives you a sign or a wonder' as literal; 'among you' reflects Hebrew 'קרבך'.

verses.text: and the sign or the wonder comes to pass, of which he spoke to you, saying, 'Let us go after other gods,' which you have not known, 'and let us serve them,'
verses.comment: Keeps the conditional clause structure from Hebrew; 'Let us go after other gods' is literal.

verses.text: you shall not listen to the words of that prophet or that dreamer of dreams. For the LORD your God is testing you, to know whether you love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.comment: 'Testing you, to know...' is literal as in Hebrew. 'Heart and soul' follows Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: You shall walk after the LORD your God, and fear him, and keep his commandments, and obey his voice. You shall serve him and cling to him.
verses.comment: 'Cling to him' translates 'דבקה' (deveqah), rendered 'hold fast' in many translations.

verses.text: But that prophet or that dreamer of dreams shall be put to death, because he has spoken rebellion against the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of slavery, to lead you astray from the way the LORD your God commanded you to walk. So you shall purge the evil from your midst.
verses.comment: 'Purge the evil from your midst' is a literal phrase used throughout Deuteronomy.

verses.text: If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son or your daughter, or the wife you embrace, or your friend who is as your own soul entices you secretly, saying, 'Let us go and serve other gods'—which you have not known, you nor your fathers—
verses.comment: 'The wife you embrace' translates literally 'the wife of your bosom.'

verses.text: of the gods of the peoples who are around you, near to you or far from you, from the one end of the earth to the other end of the earth,
verses.comment: Phrase 'from one end of the earth to the other' is direct from the Hebrew.

verses.text: you shall not consent to him or listen to him, nor shall your eye pity him, nor shall you spare him or conceal him,
verses.comment: 'Nor shall your eye pity him' is a Hebrew idiom for showing no mercy.

verses.text: but you shall surely kill him. Your hand shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people.
verses.comment: 'You shall surely kill him' uses Hebrew intensification for emphasis.

verses.text: You shall stone him with stones so that he dies, because he sought to draw you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.comment: Capital punishment by stoning; 'the house of slavery' is literal.

verses.text: And all Israel shall hear and fear, and never again do such wickedness as this among you.
verses.comment: 'Shall hear and fear' is a common phrase in Deuteronomy.

verses.text: If you hear, in one of your cities which the LORD your God gives you to dwell there,
verses.comment: References cities given by YHWH, God's covenant faithfulness.

verses.text: that certain worthless men have gone out from among you and have enticed the inhabitants of their city, saying, 'Let us go and serve other gods,' which you have not known,
verses.comment: 'Worthless men' translates 'sons of Belial' (בני בליעל) as an idiom.

verses.text: then you shall inquire and make search and ask diligently. And, behold, if it is true and certain that such an abomination has been done among you,
verses.comment: The triple phrase 'inquire, make search, ask diligently' translates the Hebrew legal formula closely.

verses.text: you shall surely strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, devoting it to destruction, all who are in it and its livestock, with the edge of the sword.
verses.comment: 'Devoting it to destruction' translates 'herem'—total destruction for God's judgment.

verses.text: And you shall gather all its spoil into the middle of its open square and burn the city and all its spoil entirely with fire to the LORD your God. It shall be a heap forever. It shall not be rebuilt.
verses.comment: 'Heap forever' renders 'tel olam', the ruins left as a perpetual warning.

verses.text: Not any of the devoted things shall cling to your hand, so that the LORD may turn from his fierce anger and show you mercy and have compassion on you and multiply you, as he swore to your fathers,
verses.comment: Literally, 'No devoted thing shall cling to your hand'—do not keep anything from the city.

verses.text: if you obey the voice of the LORD your God, to keep all his commandments that I am commanding you today, and to do what is right in the eyes of the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Concludes with a conditional blessing formula common in Deuteronomy.
